name: Upper Body Mass & Strength Breakthrough Program
description: An 8-week intermediate program designed to break through plateaus and build significant upper body mass while maintaining lower body strength. Combines strength training with hypertrophy work using efficient supersets.

phases.name: Foundation & Volume Phase
phases.focus: Building training capacity and muscle endurance while establishing strength base
phases.explanation: This phase establishes a solid foundation with higher volume training to increase work capacity and create the muscle damage necessary for hypertrophy. We'll use moderate weights with higher rep ranges to build muscle endurance and prepare for the intensive phase.
phases.expectations: Expect muscle soreness initially as volume increases. Energy levels may dip in week 2-3 before adaptation occurs. You should notice improved muscle pumps and endurance by week 4.
keyPoints: Focus on perfect form with controlled tempo
Prioritize upper body volume while maintaining lower body
Use supersets to maximize time efficiency

workouts.name: Upper Power
workouts.focus: Heavy compound movements for strength foundation

exercises.name: Bench Press
exercises.notes: Main chest builder - focus on breaking plateau
instructions: Retract shoulder blades and maintain arch
Lower bar to chest with control

exercises.name: Barbell Rows
instructions: Hinge at hips, maintain neutral spine
Pull bar to lower chest/upper abdomen

exercises.name: Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Avoid behind-neck position due to shoulder impingement
instructions: Start with bar at shoulder height

exercises.name: Weighted Pull-ups
instructions: Pull chest to bar, not just chin over

exercises.name: Cable Rows
instructions: Keep chest up and shoulders back

workouts.name: Lower Body Power
workouts.focus: Lower body strength and power development

exercises.name: Back Squats
instructions: Bar on upper traps, feet shoulder-width
Sit back and down, knees track over toes

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlifts
instructions: Start with bar at hip level
Push hips back, slight knee bend
Lower bar to mid-shin, feel hamstring stretch

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squats
instructions: Lower into lunge, front knee tracks over toe
Drive through front heel to return

exercises.name: Leg Curls
instructions: Adjust pad to back of ankles

exercises.name: Walking Lunges
instructions: Keep torso upright, front knee over ankle
Push off front foot to next step

exercises.name: Calf Raises
instructions: Rise up on balls of feet

exercises.name: Plank
instructions: Maintain straight line from head to heels

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
instructions: Start with dumbbells at shoulder level

exercises.name: Chest Flyes
instructions: Feel stretch in chest at bottom

exercises.name: Front Raises
instructions: Keep arms straight with slight bend

workouts.name: Pull Focus
workouts.focus: Back, rear delts, and biceps hypertrophy

exercises.name: Pull-ups
instructions: Dead hang start, full range of motion

exercises.name: T-Bar Rows
instructions: Chest on pad, slight knee bend

workouts.name: Legs & Core
workouts.focus: Lower body hypertrophy and core strength

exercises.name: Walking Lunges
exercises.notes: 10 per leg, superset with leg press

nutrition.notes: Moderate calorie surplus to support muscle growth. Focus on whole foods and adequate protein timing around workouts.

progressionProtocol: Week 1: Learn movement patterns, establish baselines
Week 2: Add weight when hitting top rep range
Week 3-4: Focus on progressive overload, increase weight 2.5-5lbs when possible

phases.name: Intensity & Strength Phase
phases.focus: Heavy strength work with strategic volume to break through plateaus
phases.explanation: This phase shifts focus to heavier loads and lower rep ranges to build maximum strength while maintaining muscle mass. We'll target your bench press plateau specifically while continuing to build overall upper body mass through strategic volume work.
phases.expectations: Expect to handle heavier weights and see strength gains. Recovery may take longer due to intensity. You should break through your bench press plateau and see significant strength increases across all lifts.
keyPoints: Focus on breaking through bench press plateau
Use heavier loads with longer rest periods
Maintain muscle mass with strategic accessory work

workouts.name: Upper Strength
workouts.focus: Maximum strength development for upper body

exercises.name: Bench Press
exercises.notes: Plateau-breaking protocol - focus on form and power

exercises.name: Weighted Pull-ups
exercises.notes: Heavy vertical pull to balance bench

exercises.name: Close Grip Bench Press
exercises.notes: Bench press accessory for lockout strength

exercises.name: Dumbbell Rows
instructions: Support with one hand and knee

workouts.name: Lower Body Strength
workouts.focus: Maximum lower body strength and power

workouts.name: Push Strength
workouts.focus: Pressing strength and upper body power

exercises.name: Deadlifts
instructions: Lock out hips and shoulders together

exercises.name: Chest Supported Rows
exercises.notes: Heavy rowing without lower back fatigue

workouts.name: Legs & Power
workouts.focus: Lower body power and muscle building

mealTiming: Post-workout: Immediately with protein and carbs
Before bed: Casein protein or cottage cheese
nutrition.notes: Increased calories to support heavy training. Focus on nutrient timing around intense sessions. Consider creatine supplementation for strength gains.

progressionProtocol: Week 3: Peak intensity - attempt PR loads
Week 4: Deload with 80% volume, maintain intensity
